unnormalised: It all started with a missed deadline. Diwali was around the corner, and the pressure to gift something nice to my family was mounting. My existing credit card limit of Rs. 50000 just wasn't cutting it. I considered asking bhai for a loan, but the thought of explaining my situation was daunting.
normalised: It all started with a missed deadline. Diwali was around the corner, and the pressure to gift something nice to my family was mounting. My existing credit card limit of rupees fifty thousand just wasn't cutting it. I considered asking bhai for a loan, but the thought of explaining my situation was daunting.

unnormalised: Then, an ad popped up on my phone: "Personal Loan @ 12% p.a. Get Instant Approval!" Tempting, right? Especially when I needed approximately ₹75000 urgently. I filled out the online form, providing my PAN card and Aadhaar details, half-expecting to be rejected. To my surprise, within 2 hrs, I got a notification: "Loan Approved! ₹80,000 sanctioned."
normalised: Then, an ad popped up on my phone: "Personal Loan at twelve percent per annum. Get Instant Approval!" Tempting, right? Especially when I needed approximately rupee seventy five thousand urgently. I filled out the online form, providing my P-A-N card and Aadhaar details, half-expecting to be rejected. To my surprise, within two hours, I got a notification: "Loan Approved! rupee eighty thousand sanctioned."

unnormalised: The initial euphoria quickly faded when I saw the fine print. The processing fee was a hefty 2.5% of the loan amount, plus GST, which came to a considerable sum. The monthly EMI, while seemingly manageable at ₹2800, stretched my already tight budget. I hadn't factored in the impact on my CIBIL score if I missed even one payment.
normalised: The initial euphoria quickly faded when I saw the fine print. The processing fee was a hefty two point five percent of the loan amount, plus G-S-T, which came to a considerable sum. The monthly E-M-I, while seemingly manageable at rupees two thousand eight hundred, stretched my already tight budget. I hadn't factored in the impact on my C-I-B-I-L score if I missed even one payment.

unnormalised: For the first few months, everything was fine. But then, unexpected medical expenses for Amma cropped up. Paying the EMI on time became a struggle. One month, I was 5 days late. I received a barrage of calls from the lender, reminding me of the late payment penalty of Rs. 500 + GST. Stress levels? Through the roof!
normalised: For the first few months, everything was fine. But then, unexpected medical expenses for Amma cropped up. Paying the E-M-I on time became a struggle. One month, I was five days late. I received a barrage of calls from the lender, reminding me of the late payment penalty of rupees five hundred plus G-S-T. Stress levels? Through the roof!

unnormalised: Lesson learned: taking a loan, even a small one, requires careful planning and understanding the terms. That "instant approval" can come with a long-term commitment. Next time, I'll save up beforehand, even if it means gifting slightly less extravagant presents. Maybe a lovely saree for Amma and a good quality cricket bat for Rohan, all bought with cash. No more EMI stress for this family!
